meanings.definition: Not wise or prudent; lacking in good judgment.
meanings.sent1: It was impolitic to leave the house unlocked when going on vacation.
meanings.sent2: It is impolitic to make important decisions without thinking them through.
meanings.sent3: It was impolitic of him to wear shorts in the snow.
meanings.sent4: Her impolitic choice of words caused a misunderstanding.
meanings.sent5: The impolitic decision led to serious consequences.

meanings.definition: Not suitable for the circumstances; inappropriate.
meanings.sent1: It was impolitic to wear a swimsuit to a formal event.
meanings.sent2: His impolitic behavior at the meeting offended many people.
meanings.sent3: It seemed impolitic to bring a loudspeaker to a library.
meanings.sent4: The impolitic color choice for the room made it feel smaller.
meanings.sent5: The impolitic joke during the presentation fell flat.
